title: HTTP trace method is enabled on aspen.io

profile.name: Gratipay
profile.about: Gratitude? Gratipay! The easiest way for your company to pay for open source.

vulnerability_information:
Hello,

HTTP TRACE method is enabled on your server which should not be enabled. It can lead to cross site tracing ! I think this is not a critical issue but I thought I will still report because it is always better to fix it :)

Cross site tracing: https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross_Site_Tracing

```
$ curl -X TRACE http://aspen.io -vv                                                                                                        [19:57:58]
* Rebuilt URL to: http://aspen.io/
*   Trying 23.21.203.159...
* Connected to aspen.io (23.21.203.159) port 80 (#0)
> TRACE / HTTP/1.1
> Host: aspen.io
> User-Agent: curl/7.50.1
> Accept: */*
> 
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Server: Cowboy
< Date: Sat, 04 Feb 2017 14:28:44 GMT
< Connection: close
< Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
< Via: 1.1 vegur
< 

```

## Mitigation:

Disable TRACE method support on your server.

activities.message:
Hi,

Thank you for your report, the receipt of which we herewith confirm. We are currently verifying the issue you reported.

Please expect additional feedback from us within the next couple of days. The "INFORMATION SECURITY" section of the following page has additional, useful information regarding our platform's security: http://inside.gratipay.com/howto/manage-risk

We appreciate your interest in securing our platform and look forward to working with you.

Yours sincerely,
The Gratipay Security Team

Yours sincerely,

activities.message:
Hi @a0xnirudh,

Thanks for the report. Unfortunately, this has already been reported to us. Actually, you even notified us of this issue in the past: #117257. ;)

We look forward to more reports from you in the future.

Best regards,
Ed
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @a0xnirudh,

We look forward to more reports from you in the future.

activities.message:
Hello @edio ,

I think I forgot that I already reported it in the past but just like the other report, did you notice the problem here ? When I reported #117257, your team closed it saying that it is a duplicate of #117142 but #117142 is now closed as resolved and you can see that the report was only about TRACE enabled in inside.gratipay.com.

Fundamentally what happened here is, your team missed fixing the issue on `aspen.io` and thinking everything is fixed, your team closed the report #117142. I cross checked it again before reporting the vulnerability here and since I came to know that the fix didn't happen on aspen.io, I reported again (I should have commented on my old report but I guess I forgot about that).

This means the report is about a vulnerability your team knew before but forgotten to fix. I don't think there is an open or triaged report regarding this issue to make this duplicate ? (#117142 is already closed as resolved so what is the point in making this report a duplicate of that).

I think if you are planning to fix it, this is a valid report. Please discuss it with your team and let me know and I hope this get resolved soon (and rather not forgotten again).

Thanks !

Thanks !

Ed

activities.message: aspen.io used to be part of our security program but hasn't been for a while now.
activities.markdown_message: aspen.io used to be part of our security program but hasn't been for a while now.

activities.message:
@whit537 When I was reporting this bug, I specifically looked at your rules and it clearly mentioned that `All websites under your github is in scope` and which is the reason why I reported. I think this should be considered and you should clearly mention the scope on the rules page so that future reports won't come on this.

Since this is a simple bug to fix, I think its better to go ahead and resolve it.
activities.markdown_message:
@whit537 When I was reporting this bug, I specifically looked at your rules and it clearly mentioned that All websites under your github is in scope and which is the reason why I reported. I think this should be considered and you should clearly mention the scope on the rules page so that future reports won't come on this.

Since this is a simple bug to fix, I think its better to go ahead and resolve it.

activities.message:
Hi @a0xnirudh,

I am terribly sorry about this whole mix up. All of this happened, because I am new to Gratipay's security team so I will take the blame for this. I am currently working on updating our policy to ensure this does not happen again in the future.

Concerning this statement:

> All websites under your github is in scope

I am not aware of aspen.io being part of our GitHub organisation. Would you mind pointing out where you noticed this?

Best regards,
Ed
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @a0xnirudh,

I am terribly sorry about this whole mix up. All of this happened, because I am new to Gratipay's security team so I will take the blame for this. I am currently working on updating our policy to ensure this does not happen again in the future.

Concerning this statement:

All websites under your github is in scope

I am not aware of aspen.io being part of our GitHub organisation. Would you mind pointing out where you noticed this?

Best regards,
Ed

activities.message:
Hey @edio ,

Oops, even I got confused. Actually I saw it in `aspen.io` itself. If you visit http://aspen.io, at the bottom of the page, you can see that "security" link points to `hackerone.com/gratipay` clearly indicating that any security bugs are welcome. I think that's how I came to it.

If `aspen.io` is out of scope, I suggest you:

1) Resolve this bug (as its reported before you guys explicitly made it out of scope)

2) Remove the links from the site http://aspen.io.

3) Also it would be great if you can explicitly mention in your scope that the site `aspen.io` is out of scope. This would make sure the confusion won't be raised with future bug reporters.
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @edio ,

Oops, even I got confused. Actually I saw it in aspen.io itself. If you visit http://aspen.io, at the bottom of the page, you can see that "security" link points to hackerone.com/gratipay clearly indicating that any security bugs are welcome. I think that's how I came to it.

If aspen.io is out of scope, I suggest you:

1) Resolve this bug (as its reported before you guys explicitly made it out of scope)

2) Remove the links from the site http://aspen.io.

3) Also it would be great if you can explicitly mention in your scope that the site aspen.io is out of scope. This would make sure the confusion won't be raised with future bug reporters.

activities.message:
Hi @a0xnirudh,

Thank you for pointing out where the issues lies. We will compromise and resolve this issue (giving you some reputation), but I cannot say whether this will be eligible for a bounty or not.

I will let the dev team know that the "Security" link on aspen.io needs to be removed. On top of that, we are working on updating our HackerOne policy and will make it very clear what domains are not in scope of our program.

~~~diff
+Out of scope domains:
+
+~~~
+aspen.io
+*.aspen.io
+~~~
+
~~~

Link to PR: https://github.com/gratipay/inside.gratipay.com/pull/1018

Best regards,
Ed
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @a0xnirudh,

Thank you for pointing out where the issues lies. We will compromise and resolve this issue (giving you some reputation), but I cannot say whether this will be eligible for a bounty or not.

I will let the dev team know that the "Security" link on aspen.io needs to be removed. On top of that, we are working on updating our HackerOne policy and will make it very clear what domains are not in scope of our program.

+Out of scope domains:
+
+~~~
+aspen.io
+*.aspen.io
+~~~
+

Link to PR: https://github.com/gratipay/inside.gratipay.com/pull/1018

Best regards,
Ed

activities.message:
> reported before you guys explicitly made it out of scope

Actually, Aspen has been out of scope here for [almost a year](https://github.com/gratipay/inside.gratipay.com/issues/509).

> Remove the links from the site http://aspen.io.

[Done](https://github.com/AspenWeb/aspen.py/issues/42), thanks for catching that!

> explicitly mention in your scope that the site `aspen.io` is out of scope.

I'm -1 on this, because with the above changes there's no reason to think it would be in scope.

explicitly mention in your scope that the site aspen.io is out of scope.

activities.message:
@whit537,

1) First of all, if you think from my perspective, I read the program rules before submitting the report and there its not ,mentioned that `aspen.io` is out of scope.

2) When I came to the site `aspen.io` website, it is clearly stated below the site, a security link to `hackerone.com/gratipay` which clearly means to any people that bug reports are welcome to hackerone isn't it ?

So if you think about this, its your team's mistake that you forgot to remove it and which is the reason why I reported. So if I were you, I would give the credits to the researcher by resolving this instead of closing as `informative` but final decision is yours and I respect that.

Thanks !
